title: President of Kyrgyzstan - Wikipedia
snippet: Askar Akayev was forced from office ... was peacefully succeeded by Sooronbay Jeenbekov in 2017. However, Jeenbekov resigned from office due to the 2020 Kyrgyzstani protests and was succeeded by Sadyr Japarov....

title: 2020 Kyrgyz Revolution - Wikipedia
snippet: Jeenbekov resigned as President of Kyrgyzstan in an attempt to end the unrest, while stating that he "calls on Japarov and the other politicians to withdraw their supporters out of the capital of the nation and to return the people of Bishkek to peaceful lives".

title: Hopes dim for reformed Kyrgyzstan as new president consolidates power - Atlantic Council
snippet: Recently imprisoned Sadyr Japarov has consolidated power, taking over as prime minister before installing himself as the acting president.

title: What Kyrgyzstan’s hasty transition to presidential governance says about the state of its democracy
snippet: In January 2021, the citizens of ... Sadyr Japarov. While some argue this move could bring stability to the deeply divided society, others point out that it could also mark the beginning of a shift away from the openness that earned the country its reputation as the freest society in Central Asia · 2020 was a particularly eventful year for Kyrgyzstan: in the midst of the global COVID-19 pandemic, the country experienced unrest that resulted in its third revolution and the fall of the Soorinbai Jeenbekov government in October 2020....

title: Sadyr Japarov - Wikipedia
snippet: Sadyr Nurgojo uulu Japarov (born 6 December 1968) is a Kyrgyz politician who has been serving as the sixth president of Kyrgyzstan since 28 January 2021. He previously served as the 22nd prime minister in the 2020 interim government, following ...
